newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL -Netscape up on Oracle pact.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL -Netscape up on Oracle pact.

text.p: Netscape Communications Corp shares traded higher preceding Monday's U.S. after the company announced it and Oracle Corp will merge affilates that develop Internet access software, traders said.
In early third market trade, Netscape rose one to 30-1/4, while Oracle made no moves, they said.

Earlier, the companies announced a definitive agreement to merge Netscape's Navio Communications and Oracle's Network Computer Inc. The new company will develop Internet access software for open standards-based network computers and other Internet appliances, the companies said.
Financial terms of the deal were not disclosed.
Westell Technologies Inc and DSC Communications shares firmed on news the companies will provide Internet access technology and hardware, respectively, to Bell Atlantic Corp.
Before the market open, Westell traded at 20-7/16, up from 19-1/4, and DSC was up to 23-1/2 from 22-5/8, traders said.
